page.title: 10RADIO IN THE '20s & '30s
page.content: Interview by Avtar Singh and Phillip Allcock. Eric is 84 and was a technician.Public broadcasting started in 1922 and was very popular because,"You could shut yourself off from the rest of the world," something you could not do with a gramaphone.He made his first radio from cardboard tubing and a coil of wire;this was connected to a crystal and then to an aerial to pick up signals.You listened to the prog- -ramme through headphones.The main problem was that moving the wireless could untune the crystal and it was difficult to retune.Eric listened to the radio mostly in the evening;he usually tuned into Radio Luxemburg.Ra- -dios today are much easier to tune in;there are many more channels and the range of programmes is much wider, according to Eric.
